releases.name: PARSE
releases.description: Police Accident Report Sampling Engine PARSE is a web application Production within CDAN to collect, manage, store and make available to CDAN data acquisition projects, Police Accident Reports PAR data collected via electronic or physical methods for the purposes of selection within a appropriate NHTSA data collection program.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: CISSWeb
releases.description: Crash Investigation Sampling System CISS Web CISSWeb application consists of motor vehicle crash and injury data collected from Police Accident Reports PARS gathered through a network of remote field sites around the country operated and managed under contract by NHTSA.  CISSWeb is the application that consolidates all the data collected within the lifecycle of the case, regardless of the source. Specific PARs are selected for followup investigation via a sample algorithm designed to target towed late model vehicle, specific injuries and/or crashes of special interest to NHTSA. In addition to PAR and injury data, field Data Technicians collect data by inspecting and recording damage to case vehicles, inspecting and collecting data from crash scenes and enhancing vehicle and scene data with digital imagery. When possible, contractors conduct occupant interviews.  NHTSA uses the CISS data collected to evaluate the conditions present at the time of the crash, injuries resulting from crashes, vehicle crashworthiness, special types of crashes e.g., air bag deployment, and crashes of high public interest e.g., school bus crashes.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: iREx
releases.description: iREx integrated Risk Executive is a NHTSAdeveloped  automated Risk Management system for its IT investments. It is compliant to federal regulations implements NIST SP 80037 Risk Management Framework guidance and processes to ensure that Riskbased decision making is a tangible feature of the NHTSA risk management processes. It is collaboratively used by NHTSA's PMO, EA, CPIC and cybersecurity components in riskbased decisioning. iREx ensures that risk mitigation is linked to identifiable combinations of security issues that are recorded and managed in order to address and measure each relevant risk and vulnerability.  iREx is a webbased application with a SQLbased database backend.  It has capabilities to generate Assessment and Analysis reports used to support DOT/NHTSA Risk Posture, and C&A of its IT systems.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: NAF
releases.description: NAF NHTSA Asset Framework is the NHTSAdeveloped system that serves as its IT Asset metadata management, analysis and reporting platform. This  includes  IT hardware, software assets information in the following contexts: technical specifications, licensing information, SLA management, capital planning, acquisition, and enterprise architecture TRM.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: MR Tool (SDAG)
releases.description: MR Tool Service Data Architecture Group Metadata Repository is the NHTSAdeveloped DOT standard system that supports  DOT's continuing implementation of OMB M1313 through DOT Order 1351.34 for DOT OA data and information to be disclosed rapidly in forms that the public can readily find and use.  As such, it is tailored as an analysis and reporting system holding metadata  describing DOT OA datasets, and is designed to conform to the latest federal Open Data metadata schema https://projectopendata.cio.gov/v1.1/schema/.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: TravelOnTrack
releases.description: TravelOnTrack is used to track allocated agency travel budgets by office and fiscal year. It manages and tracks submitted travel proposals, plans and completed travel information, including associated budget and overage data. It enables transfer of unused funds in an office as necessary. TravelOnTrack generates summary reports on available funds and usage of approved/proposed travels and other travelrelated reports.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: SISAME/discontinued
releases.description: NHTSA funded the development of the SISAME program starting in the late 1980�s until the mid 2000�s.  This program provides a very unique capability for mass/spring multibody model extraction from test data.   NHTSA has discontinued support or development for the SISAME program
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: vPIC-List
releases.description: The NHTSA Product Information Catalog and Vehicle Listing vPIC is a consolidated platform that presents data collected within the manufacturer reported data from CFR 49 Parts 551 � 574 for use in a variety of modern tools. NHTSA�s vPIC platform is intended to serve as a centralized source for basic Vehicle Identification Number VIN decoding, Manufacturer Information Database MID, Manufacturer Equipment Plant Identification and associated data.  vPIC is primarily intended for use on Model Years 1995 forward. Data prior to 1995 may be available depending on the manufacturer, which is based on submittals received by NHTSA. This includes passenger vehicles, trucks, buses, trailers / trailer kits, incomplete vehicles, low speed vehicles and motorcycles to name a few as the primary categories. Vehicles within these major categories are further defined by the details provided by the manufacturers in accordance to reporting standards of CFR 49 Part 565 and 566.
releases.exemptiontext: null

By providing access to these data, the USDOT aims to enable third-party research into the effectiveness of emerging ITS technologies, preliminary development of third-party applications, and harmonization of data across similar collections.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: Intelligent Transportation Systems Operational Data Environment (ITS ODE)
releases.description: The ITS ODE is a real-time virtual data router that ingests and processes operational data from various connected devices � including vehicles, infrastructure, and traffic management centers � and distributes it to other devices and subscribing transportation management applications. Using the ITS ODE within intelligent transportation deployments increases data fluidity and interoperability while meeting operational needs and protecting user privacy. The software�s microservices architecture makes it easy to add new capabilities to meet local needs.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: UASRS
releases.description: Unmanned Aircraft Systems Registration Service (UASRS) is used by the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to provide small Unmanned Aircraft System (sUAS) operators/owners a service to register all sUAS for the purpose of Production sUAS in U.S. air space. sUAS are defined as those aircraft that weigh more than 0.55 pounds but less than 55 pounds. This service educates new operators about airspace rules so they can use their unmanned aircraft safely. As part of the registration process, registrants acknowledge that they have read, understand, and intend to follow the safety guidance. The service allows the FAA to identify and take enforcement action against those who intentionally violate the rules or operate unsafely.
releases.exemptiontext: This code was not developed with the expectation that it would be released as Open Source. Preliminary review has identified operational procedures which if made public may expose FAA systems to cyber security attacks. Further review is required to fully analyze and mitigate any security issues which may result from making the code public. This review cannot be completed in the time remaining for the current release schedule.

releases.name: B4UFly
releases.description: B4UFLY is a UAS Mobile Application that enables a small UAS or model aircraft operator the ability to check their current location for conformance with FAA published guidelines prior to flight operations.  This will assist model aircraft users to conform to Public Law 112-95, Section 336: Special Rule for Model Aircraft (FMRA) which outlines what a model aircraft is and how it can be legally operated within the national airspace.
releases.exemptiontext: This code was not developed with the expectation that it would be released as Open Source. Preliminary review has identified operational procedures which if made public may expose FAA systems to cyber security attacks. Further review is required to fully analyze and mitigate any security issues which may result from making the code public. This review cannot be completed in the time remaining for the current release schedule.

releases.name: APRA
releases.description: Aeronautic Product Release API (APRA) provides the private sector greater access to core FAA data to spur more innovation in the aviation industry, and ultimately advance the FAA�s mission of safety in flight.  Based on stakeholder recommendations, this initiative�s first effort strived to provide both more data and better data for Aeronautical products and information. Solution Delivery developed and deployed web services for several aeronautical products including both information about those products and the ability to automatically download those products which satisfied one of the recommendations.
releases.exemptiontext: null

releases.name: EDCS
releases.description: Enterprise Data Control Service - A set of common infrastructure services. Web based common access point.  Fully documented data history enabling trust .  Access control is documented and enforced - Enabled data resources have REST APIs that comply with documentation and dissemination control
releases.exemptiontext: This code was not developed with the expectation that it would be released as Open Source. Preliminary review has identified operational procedures which if made public may expose FAA systems to cyber security attacks. Further review is required to fully analyze and mitigate any security issues which may result from making the code public. This review cannot be completed in the time remaining for the current release schedule.
